National Article Title: Anchoring Wood-Frame Roof Systems to Masonry Walls
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), roof systems of wood-frame construction shall be anchored to exterior masonry walls by not less than 12.7 mm diam anchor bolts, spaced not more than 2.4 m apart, embedded not less than 90 mm into the masonry, and fastened to a rafter plate of not less than 38 mm thick lumber.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), roof systems of wood frame construction shall be tied to exterior masonry walls by not less than 12.7 mm diam anchor bolts,(a) spaced not more than 2.4 m apart, (b) embedded not less that 90 mm into the masonry, and (c) fastened to a rafter plate of not less than 38 mm thick lumber.
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: The units referred to in Sentence 9.20.12.1.(1) shall be corbelled so that the horizontal projection of any unit does not exceed 25 mm and the total projection does not exceed one third of the total wall thickness.

National Sentence Text: In situations described in Sentence 9.20.13.9.(1), flashing shall be provided where water will accumulate, to lead it to the exterior.

National Sentence Text: Where no flashing is installed beneath window sills, such sills shall be provided with a drip not less than 25 mm from the wall surface.

National Sentence Text: A chimney flue that serves a solid-fuel-burning appliance shall not be connected to an oil-burning appliance unless the solid-fuel-burning appliance is certified for such installation and the installation of both appliances meets the requirements of the relevant standards referenced in Article 9.33.5.2.

National Article Title: Connections of More Than One Appliance

National Sentence Text: Clay liners shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-A324-M88 Clay Flue Liners

P/T Sentence Text: The space required in Sentence (1) shall not be filled with mortar.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Chimney liners used in chimneys for solid-fuel-burning appliances shall be laid in a full bed of high temperature cement mortar conforming to CAN/CGSB-10.3, Air Setting Refractory Mortar, or mortar consisting of 1 part Portland cement to 3 parts sand by volume.
P/T Sentence Text: Chimney liners used in chimneys for solid fuel-burning appliances shall be laid in a full bed of,(a) high temperature cement mortar conforming to CAN/CGSB-10.3, "Air Setting Refractory Mortar", or (b) mortar consisting of one part Portland cement to three parts sand by volume.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: The walls of a masonry chimney shall be built of solid masonry units not less than 75 mm thick.
P/T Sentence Text: The walls of a masonry chimney shall be built of solid masonry units not less than 70 mm thick.
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: The clearance between masonry or concrete chimneys and combustible framing shall be not less than 50 mm for interior chimneys, and 12 mm for exterior chimneys.
P/T Sentence Text: The clearance between masonry or concrete chimneys and combustible framing material shall be not less than,(a) 50 mm for interior chimneys, and (b) 12 mm for exterior chimneys. (See Appendix A.)
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Combustible flooring and subflooring shall have not less than a 12 mm clearance from masonry or concrete chimneys.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible flooring, subflooring and ceiling finishes shall have not less than a 12 mm clearance from masonry or concrete chimneys.
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: Joists or beams may be supported on masonry walls which enclose chimney flues provided the combustible members are separated from the flue by not less than 290 mm of solid masonry.
P/T Sentence Text: Joists or beams may be supported on masonry walls that enclose chimney flues provided the combustible members are separated from the flue by a minimum of 290 mm of solid masonry.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Where a supply of combustion air is provided directly to the fire chamber of a fireplace, including a factory-built fireplace, the installation shall comply with the "Outdoor Air Supply" requirements provided in CSA CAN/CSA-A405-M87 Design and Construction of Masonry Chimneys and Fireplaces
P/T Sentence Text: Where a supply of combustion air is provided directly to the fire chamber of a fireplace, including a factory-built fireplace or a steel fireplace liner, the installation shall comply with the "Outdoor Air Supply" requirements provided in CAN/CSA-A405-M, "Design and Construction of Masonry Chimneys and Fireplaces".
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Where the fire chamber floor is elevated more than 150 mm above the hearth, the dimension of the hearth measured perpendicular to the plane of the fireplace opening shall be increased by not less than 50 mm for an elevation above 150 mm and not more than 300 mm, and an additional 25 mm for every 50 mm in elevation above 300 mm.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the fire chamber floor is elevated more than 150 mm above the hearth, the dimension of the hearth measured perpendicular to the plane of the fireplace opening shall be increased by not less than,(a) 50 mm for an elevation above 150 mm and not more than 300 mm, and (b) an additional 25 mm for every 50 mm in elevation above 300 mm.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Combustible material shall not be placed on or near the face of a fireplace within 150 mm of the fireplace opening, except that where the combustible material projects more than 38 mm out from the face of the fireplace above the opening, such material shall be not less than 300 mm above the top of the opening.
P/T Sentence Text: Combustible material shall not be placed on or near the face of a fireplace within 150 mm of the fireplace opening, except that where the combustible material projects more than 38 mm out from the face of the fireplace above the opening, such material shall be at least 300 mm above the top of the opening.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Fireplace inserts and hearth-mounted stoves vented through the throat of a fireplace shall conform to ULC ULC-S628-93 Fireplace Inserts
P/T Sentence Text: Fireplace inserts and hearth mounted stoves vented through the throat of a fireplace shall conform to ULC-S628, "Fireplace Inserts".
Label: Common Sentence

National Article Title: Spans for Joists, Rafters and Beams
National Sentence Text: Spans for built-up wood and glued-laminated timber floor beams shall conform to the spans in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-H to 9.23.4.2.-K. (See Article 9.4.2.2.)
P/T Article Title: 9.23.4.2. Spans for Joists, Rafters and Beams (See Appendix
P/T Sentence Text: Spans for built-up wood and glued-laminated timber floor beams shall conform to the spans in Tables A-8 to A-11.
Variation Label: Spans for Joists, Rafters and Beams
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: Where a floor is required to support a concrete topping not more than 51 mm thick, the allowable beam spans shown in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-H to 9.23.4.2.-K shall be multiplied by 0.8 or the supported length of the floor joists shall be reduced to allow for the loads due to the topping.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a floor is required to support a concrete topping not more than 51 mm thick, the beam spans shown in TablesÃ A-8 to A-11 shall be multiplied by 0.8 or the supported length of the floor joists shall be reduced to allow for the loads due to the topping.
Label: Common Sentence

National Article Title: Levelling and Sealing of Sill Plates
National Sentence Text: Sill plates shall be levelled by setting them on a full bed of mortar, or laid directly on the foundation if the top of the foundation is level. (See also Article 9.23.2.3.)
P/T Sentence Text: Sill plates shall be,(a) levelled by setting them on a full bed of mortar, or (b) laid directly on the foundation where the top of the foundation is level.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence 9.23.8.3.(3), where individual members of a built-up beam are butted together to form a joint, the joint shall occur over a support.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence (3), where individual members of a built-up beam are butted together to form a joint, the joint shall occur over a support.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.8.3.(8), where 38 mm members are laid on edge to form a built-up beam, individual members shall be nailed together with a double row of nails not less than 89 mm in length, spaced not more than 450 mm apart in each row with the end nails located 100 mm to 150 mm from the end of each piece.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (8), where 38 mm members are laid on edge to form a built-up beam, individual members shall be nailed together with a double row of nails not less than 89 mm in length, spaced not more than 450 mm apart in each row with the end nails located 100 mm to 150 mm from the end of each piece.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: When framed into the side of a wood beam, joists referred to in Sentence (1) shall be supported on joist hangers or other acceptable mechanical connectors, or not less than 38 mm by 64 mm ledger strips nailed to the side of the beam, except that 38 mm by 38 mm ledger strips may be used provided each joist is nailed to the beam by not less than four 89 mm nails, in addition to the nailing for the ledger strip required in Table 9.23.3.4.
P/T Sentence Text: When framed into the side of a wood beam, joists referred to in Sentence (1) shall be supported on,(a) joist hangers or other acceptable mechanical connectors, or (b) not less than 38 mm by 64 mm ledger strips nailed to the side of the beam, except that 38 mm by 38 mm ledger strips may be used provided each joist is nailed to the beam by at least four 89 mm nails, in addition to the nailing for the ledger strip required in Table 9.23.3.4.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Not less than a 12 mm space shall be provided between the splice required in Sentence 9.23.9.2.(4) and the beam to allow for shrinkage of the wood joists.
P/T Sentence Text: Not less than a 12 mm space shall be provided between the splice required in Sentence (4) and the beam to allow for shrinkage of the wood joists.
Label: Common Sentence

National Article Title: Strapping, Bridging, Furring and Ceilings in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-A
National Sentence Text: When framed into the side of a wood beam, joists referred to in Sentence (1) shall be supported on joist hangers or other acceptable mechanical connectors, or not less than 38 mm by 64 mm ledger strips nailed to the side of the beam, except that 38 mm by 38 mm ledger strips may be used provided each joist is nailed to the beam by not less than four 89 mm nails, in addition to the nailing for the ledger strip required in Table 9.23.3.4.
P/T Article Title: 9.23.9.4. Strapping and Bridging in Tables A-1 and A-2
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence (5), where strapping is specified in Table A-1, it shall be,(a) not less than 19 mm by 64 mm, nailed to the underside of floor joists, (b) located not more than 2.1 m from each support or other rows of strapping, and (c) fastened at each end to a sill or header.
Label: Common Sentence

National Article Title: Strapping, Bridging, Furring and Ceilings in Span Tables 9.23.4.2.-A
National Sentence Text: Strapping described in Sentence (1) and Clause (3)(b) is not required where furring strips complying with Table 9.29.3.1. are fastened directly to the joists, or a panel-type ceiling finish complying with Subsection 9.29.5., 9.29.6., 9.29.7., 9.29.8., or 9.29.9. is attached directly to the joists.
P/T Article Title: 9.23.9.4. Strapping and Bridging in Tables A-1 and A-2
P/T Sentence Text: Strapping described in Sentence (1) and Clause (3)(b) is not required where,(a) furring strips complying with Table 9.29.3.1. are fastened directly to the joists, or (b) a panel-type ceiling finish complying with Subsection 9.29.5., 9.29.6., 9.29.7., 9.29.8., or 9.29.9. is attached directly to the joists.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (6), non-loadbearing interior walls at right angles to the floor joists are not restricted as to location.
P/T Sentence Text: Non-loadbearing interior walls at right angles to the floor joists are not restricted as to location.
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: Wall studs that support only a load from an attic not accessible by a stairway are permitted to be placed on the flat within the limits permitted in Article 9.23.10.1. provided the studs are clad on not less than one side with plywood, OSB or waferboard sheathing fastened to the face of the studs with a structural adhesive, and the portion of the roof supported by the studs does not exceed 2.1 m in width.
P/T Sentence Text: Wall studs that support only a load from an attic not accessible by a stairway are permitted to be placed on the flat within the limits permitted in Article 9.23.10.1. provided, (a) the studs are clad on at least one side with plywood, OSB or waferboard sheathing fastened to the face of the studs with a structural adhesive, and (b) the portion of the roof supported by the studs does not exceed 2.1 m in width.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.23.11.1.(2), wall plates shall be not less than 38 mm thick, and not less than the required width of the wall studs.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), wall plates shall be,(a) not less than 38 mm thick, and (b) not less than the required width of the wall studs.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences (2) to (4), at least 2 top plates shall be provided in loadbearing walls.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences (2) to (4), no fewer than two top plates shall be provided in loadbearing walls.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Ties referred to in Sentences 9.23.11.4.(2) and 9.23.11.4.(3) shall be the equivalent of not less than 75 mm by 150 mm by 0.91 mm thick galvanized steel nailed to each wall with at least three 63 mm nails.
P/T Sentence Text: Ties referred to in Sentences (2) and (3) shall be the equivalent of not less than 75 mm by 150 mm by 0.91 mm thick galvanized steel nailed to each wall with at least three 63 mm nails.
Label: Common Sentence

National Article Title: Intermediate Support for Rafters and Joists
National Sentence Text: Dwarf walls and struts are permitted to be used to provide intermediate support to reduce the span for rafters and joists.
P/T Article Title: 9.23.13.7. Intermediate Support for Rafters and Joists
P/T Sentence Text: Dwarf walls and struts may be used to provide intermediate support to reduce the span for rafters and joists.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: The ridge beam referred to in Sentence 9.23.14.8.(1) need not comply with Sentence 9.23.14.8.(2) where the beam is of not less than 38 mm by 140 mm material, and the beam is supported at intervals not exceeding 1.2 m by not less than 38 mm by 89 mm members extending vertically from the ridge to suitable bearing.
P/T Sentence Text: The ridge beam referred to in Sentence (1) need not comply with Sentence (2) where,(a) the beam is of not less than 38 mm by 140 mm material, and (b) the beam is supported at intervals not exceeding 1.2 m by not less than 38 mm by 89 mm members extending vertically from the ridge to suitable bearing.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Subflooring shall be provided beneath finish flooring where the finish flooring does not have adequate strength to support the specified live loads (see part 9.).

Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: OSB roof sheathing conforming to CSA O325, Construction Sheathing, or to O-1 and O-2 grades as specified in CSA O437.0, OSB and Waferboard, shall be installed with the direction of face orientation at right angles to the roof framing members. (See Note A-9.23.15.4.(2).)

National Sentence Text: Gypsum sheathing, rigid insulation and fibreboard shall not be used for the attachment of cladding materials.

National Sentence Text: The openings described in Sentence 9.24.3.7.(1) shall be lined with a layer of gypsum board not less than 12.7 mm thick fastened to stud and runner webs.

National Sentence Text: All walls, ceilings and floors separating conditioned space from unconditioned space, the exterior air or the ground shall be provided thermal insulation conforming to Subsection 9.25.2. and Section 9.36., an air barrier conforming to Subsection 9.25.3. and Section 9.36., and a vapour barrier conforming to Subsection 9.25.4., and constructed in such a way that the properties and relative position of all materials conform to Subsection 9.25.5.
P/T Sentence Text: All walls, ceilings and floors separating conditioned space from unconditioned space, the exterior air or the ground shall be,(a) provided with, (i) thermal insulation conforming to Subsection 9.25.2., (ii) an air barrier system conforming to Subsection 9.25.3., and (iii) a vapour barrier conforming to Subsection 9.25.4., and (b) constructed in such a way that the properties and relative position of all materials conform to Subsection 9.25.5.

National Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence 9.25.2.2.(2), thermal insulation shall conform to the requirements of ASTM C 726-12 Mineral Wool Roof Insulation Board CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.25-M87 Thermal Insulation, Phenolic, Faced CGSB 51-GP-27M-1979 Thermal Insulation, Polystyrene, Loose Fill ULC CAN/ULC-S701.1-17 Thermal Insulation, Polystyrene Boards ULC CAN/ULC-S702-14 Mineral Fibre Thermal Insulation for Buildings ULC CAN/ULC-S703-09 Cellulose Fibre Insulation for Buildings ULC CAN/ULC-S704-11 Thermal Insulation, Polyurethane and Polyisocyanurate, Boards, Faced ULC CAN/ULC-S705.1-15 Thermal Insulation â Spray Applied Rigid Polyurethane Foam, Medium Density â Material Specification or ULC CAN/ULC-S706.1-16 Wood Fibre Insulating Boards for Buildings
P/T Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence (2), thermal insulation shall conform to the requirements of,(a) ASTM C726, "Mineral Wool Roof Insulation Board," (b) CAN/CGSB-51.25-M, "Thermal Insulation, Phenolic, Faced", (c) CGSB 51-GP-27M, "Thermal Insulation, Polystyrene, Loose Fill", (d) CAN/ULC-S701.1, "Thermal Insulation, Polystyrene Boards", (e) CAN/ULC-S702 "Mineral Fibre Thermal Insulation for Buildings", (f) CAN/ULC-S703, "Cellulose Fibre Insulation for Buildings", (g) CAN/ULC-S704, "Thermal Insulation, Polyurethane and Polyisocyanurate, Boards, Faced", (h) CAN/ULC-S705.1, "Thermal Insulation - Spray Applied Rigid Polyurethane Foam, Medium Density - Material - Specification", or (i) CAN/ULC-S706.1, "Wood Fibre Insulating Boards for Buildings".

National Sentence Text: Insulation on the interior of foundation walls enclosing a crawl space shall be applied so that there is not less than 50 mm clearance above the crawl space floor, if the insulation is of a type that may be damaged by water.

National Sentence Text: Where an interior floor projects through an exterior wall or extends to become an exterior floor, continuity of the air barrier system shall be maintained from the abutting walls across the floor assembly.

P/T Sentence Text: Where an interior floor projects through an exterior wall to become an exterior floor, (a) the air barrier of the wall under the floor shall be continuous with or sealed to the subfloor or the air barrier on the underside of the floor, (b) the air barrier of the wall above the floor shall be continuous with or sealed to the subfloor or the air barrier on the top of the floor, and (c) the spaces between floor joists shall be blocked and sealed.

Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Where masonry serves as cladding on wood-frame or masonry walls exposed to precipitation, the cladding assembly shall comply with Subsections 9. to 9., and part 9., or Part 5.
P/T Sentence Text: Where masonry serves as cladding on wood frame or masonry walls exposed to precipitation, the cladding assembly shall comply with,(a) Subsections 9.27.2. to 9.27.4., and Section 9.20., or (b) Part 5.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Where an exterior insulation finish system is installed as cladding on wood-frame, masonry, cold-formed steel stud or cast-in-place concrete walls exposed to precipitation, the cladding assembly shall comply with Subsections 9.25.5., 9.27.2. to 9.27.4., and 9.27.13., or Part 5. (See Note A-9.27.1.1.(5).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where an exterior insulation finish system is installed as cladding on wood-frame, masonry, cold-formed steel stud or cast-in-place concrete walls exposed to precipitation, the cladding assembly shall comply with,(a) Subsections 9.25.5., 9.27.2. to 9.27.4. and 9.27.13., or (b) Part 5. (See Appendix A.)
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Exterior walls exposed to precipitation shall be protected against precipitation ingress by an exterior cladding assembly consisting of a first plane of protection and a second plane of protection, where such walls enclose spaces of residential occupancy or spaces that directly serve spaces of residential occupancy.
P/T Sentence Text: Exterior walls exposed to precipitation shall be protected against ingress of precipitation with an exterior cladding assembly consisting of a first plane of protection and a second plane of protection where the wall encloses spaces of residential occupancy or spaces that directly serve spaces of residential occupancy. (See Appendix A.)
Label: Common Sentence

National Article Title: Elements of the Second Plane of Protection
National Sentence Text: The protection provided by the second plane of protection shall be maintained at wall penetrations created by the installation of components and services such as windows, doors, ventilation ducts, piping, wiring and electrical outlets, and at the interface with other wall assemblies.
P/T Article Title: 9.27.3.1. Elements of the Second Plane of Protection (See
P/T Sentence Text: The protection provided by the second plane of protection shall be maintained,(a) at wall penetrations created by the installation of components and services such as windows, doors, ventilation ducts, piping, wiring and electrical outlets, and (b) at the interface with other wall assemblies.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Sheathing membranes shall conform to the performance requirements of CGSB CAN/CGSB-51.32-M77 Sheathing, Membrane, Breather Type
P/T Sentence Text: Sheathing membranes shall conform to the performance requirements of CAN/CGSB-51.32-M, "Sheathing, Membrane, Breather Type".
Label: Common Sentence

National Article Title: Insulating Sheathing in lieu of Sheathing Membrane
National Sentence Text: Where insulating sheathing is installed as provided in Sentence (1), sheathing panels subject to moisture deterioration shall be sealed at all joints, and the joints of sheathing panels not subject to moisture deterioration shall be sealed at all joints, or lapped or tongue and groove, and detailed to ensure drainage of water to the exterior. (See Note A-9.27.3.4.(2).)
P/T Article Title: 9.27.3.4. Insulating Sheathing in Lieu of Sheathing Membrane
P/T Sentence Text: Where insulating sheathing is installed as provided in Sentence (1),(a) sheathing panels subject to moisture deterioration shall be sealed at all joints, and (b) the joints of sheathing panels not subject to moisture deterioration shall be, (i) sealed at all joints, or (ii) lapped or tongue and groove, and detailed to ensure drainage of water to the exterior. (See Appendix A.)
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Metal siding consisting of sheets of metal is considered to meet the requirements of Sentence 9.27.3.6.(1) where the joints between sheets are of the locked-seam type.
P/T Sentence Text: Metal siding consisting of sheets of metal is considered to meet the requirements of Sentence (1) where the joints between sheets are of the locked-seam type.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), flashing shall be installed at every horizontal junction between cladding elements, every horizontal offset in the cladding, and every horizontal line where the cladding substrates change and where the substrates differ sufficiently for stresses to be concentrated along that line, or the installation of the cladding on the lower substrate may compromise the drainage of moisture from behind the cladding above. (See Note A-9.27.3.8.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), flashing shall be installed at,(a) every horizontal junction between claddings elements, (b) every horizontal offset in the cladding, and (c) every horizontal line where the cladding substrates change and where, (i) the substrates differ sufficiently for stresses to be concentrated along that line, or (ii) the installation of the cladding on the lower substrate may compromise the drainage of moisture from behind the cladding above. (See Appendix A.)
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Flashing described in Sentences (1) and (3) shall extend not less than 50 mm upward inboard of the sheathing membrane or sheathing installed in lieu of the sheathing membrane (see Article 9.27.3.4.), have a slope of not less than 6% toward the exterior after the expected shrinkage of the building frame, terminate at each end with an end-dam with a height in millimetres not less than 25 mm or 1/10 the value of the 1-in-5 driving rain wind pressure in Pa, and at the height defined in Subclause (c)(i), extending to the face of the adjacent cladding, lap not less than 10 mm vertically over the building element below, and terminate in a drip offset not less than 5 mm outward from the outer face of the building element below. (See Note A-9.27.3.8.(4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing described in Sentences (1) and (3) shall, (a) extend not less that 50 mm upward inboard of the sheathing membrane or sheathing installed in lieu of the sheathing membrane, (b) have a slope of not less than 6% toward the exterior after the expected shrinkage of the building frame, (c) terminate at each end with an end-dam, (i) with a height in millimetres not less than 25 mm or 1/10 of the value of the 1 in 5 driving rain wind pressure in Pa, and (ii) at the height defined in Subclause (i), extending to the face of the adjacent cladding, (d) lap not less than 10 mm vertically over the building element below, and (e) terminate in a drip extending not less than 5 mm outward from the outer face of the building element below. (See Appendix A.)
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Sealant shall be provided at vertical joints between different cladding materials unless the joint is suitably lapped or flashed to prevent the entry of rain. (See Articles 9.7.6.2. , 9.20.13.12. and 9.28.1.5.)
P/T Sentence Text: Sealant shall be provided at vertical joints between different cladding materials unless the joint is suitably lapped or flashed to prevent the entry of rain.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Where wood shingles or shakes are applied to sheathing which is not suitable for attaching the shingles or shakes, the shingles or shakes are permitted to be attached to a wood lath not less than 38 mm by 9.5 mm thick securely nailed to the framing and applied as described in Article 9.27.7.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Where wood shingles or shakes are applied to sheathing that is not suitable for attaching the shingles or shakes, the shingles or shakes may be attached to a wood lath not less than 38 mm by 9.5 mm thick securely nailed to the framing and applied as described in Article 9.27.7.5.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Shingles and shakes shall conform to CSA O118.1-08 Western Red Cedar Shakes and Shingles or CSA O118.2-08 Eastern White Cedar Shingles
P/T Sentence Text: Shingles and shakes shall conform to,(a) CSA O118.1, "Western Red Cedar Shakes and Shingles", or (b) CSA O118.2-M, "Eastern White Cedar Shingles".
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Western cedar shakes shall be not less than No. 1 or Handsplit grade, and western cedar shingles not less than No. 2 grade, except that No. 3 grade may be used for undercoursing.
P/T Sentence Text: Western cedar shakes shall be not less than No. 1 grade or Handsplit grade, and western cedar shingles not less than No. 2 grade, except that No. 3 grade may be used for undercoursing.
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: Shingles or shakes shall be fastened with nails or staples located approximately 20 mm from each edge and not less than 25 mm above the exposure line for single-course applications, or approximately 50 mm above the butt for double-course applications.
P/T Sentence Text: Shingles or shakes shall be fastened with nails located approximately 20 mm from each edge and not less than 25Ã mm above the exposure line for single-course applications, or approximately 50 mm above the butt for double-course applications.
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: The butts of the shingles or shakes shall be so located that they project not less than 12 mm below the bottom edge of the lath referred to in Sentence 9.27.7.5.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: The butts of the shingles or shakes shall be so located that they project not less than 12 mm below the bottom edge of the lath referred to in Sentence (1).
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Type 1 or 2 hardboard cladding shall be not less than 6 mm thick when applied over sheathing that provides continuous support, and 7.5 mm thick when applied over furring or framing members not more than 400 mm o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: Type 1 or 2 hardboard cladding shall be not less than,(a) 6.0 mm thick when applied over sheathing that provides continuous support, and (b) 7.5 mm thick when applied to furring or framing members not more than 406 mm o.c.
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: OSB and waferboard cladding shall conform to CSA O437.0-93 OSB and Waferboard
P/T Sentence Text: OSB and waferboard cladding shall conform to CSA O437.0, "OSB and Waferboard".
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Horizontal and vertical strip aluminum siding, including flashing and trim accessories, shall conform to CAN/CGSB-93.2-M, Prefinished Aluminum Siding, Soffits, and Fascia, for Residential Use. (See Note A-9.27.11.1.(3) and (4).)
P/T Sentence Text: Horizontal and vertical strip aluminum siding, including flashing and trim accessories, shall conform to CAN/CGSB-93.2-M, "Prefinished Aluminum Siding, Soffits and Fascia, for Residential Use". (See Appendix A.)

National Sentence Text: The materials used in EIFS shall conform to ULC CAN/ULC-S716.1-12 Exterior Insulation and Finish Systems (EIFS) - Materials and Systems
P/T Sentence Text: The materials used in exterior insulation finish systems shall conform to CAN/ULC-S716.1, "Exterior Insulation and Finish Systems (EIFS) Ã¢â¬" Materials and Systems".
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Stucco lath or reinforcing shall be used to attach stucco to masonry where the masonry is soft-burned tile or brick of less strength than the stucco, or the masonry surface is not sound, clean and sufficiently rough to provide a good key.
P/T Sentence Text: Stucco lath or reinforcing shall be used to attach stucco to masonry where,(a) the masonry is soft-burned tile or brick of less strength than the stucco, or (b) the masonry surface is not sound, clean and sufficiently rough to provide a good key.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Flashing and caulking used with stucco shall conform to Subsections 9.27.3. and 9.27.4., except that if aluminum flashing is used, it shall be separated from the stucco by an impervious membrane or coating. (See Article 9.7.6.2. for caulking around window frames.)
P/T Sentence Text: Flashing and sealants used with stucco shall conform to Subsections 9.27.3. and 9.27.4., except that if aluminum flashing is used, it shall be separated from the stucco by an impervious membrane or coating.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Stucco lath shall be fastened in conformance with part 9.
P/T Sentence Text: Stucco lath shall be fastened in conformance with Subsection 9.27.5.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Fasteners on vertical surfaces shall be spaced not more than 150 mm o.c. vertically and 400 mm o.c. horizontally, or 100 mm o.c. vertically and 600 mm o.c. horizontally.
P/T Sentence Text: Fasteners on vertical surfaces shall be spaced not more than,(a) 150 mm o.c. vertically and 406 mm o.c. horizontally, or (b) 100 mm o.c. vertically and 610 mm o.c. horizontally.

National Sentence Text: Gypsum board applications not described in this Subsection shall conform to CSA A82.31-M1980 Gypsum Board Application
P/T Sentence Text: Gypsum board applications not described in this Subsection shall conform to CSA A82.31-M, "Gypsum Board Application".
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.29.5.9.(5), for single-layer application on walls, where gypsum board provides required bracing in braced wall panels, lateral support for studs, or fire protection, screws shall be spaced not more than 300 mm o.c. on vertical wall supports, and top and bottom plates.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentence (5), for single-layer application on walls, where gypsum board is required to provide bracing, lateral support or fire protection, screws shall be spaced not more than 300 mm o.c. on,(a) vertical wall supports, and (b) top and bottom plates.
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 9.29.6.3.(2), nails for attaching plywood finishes shall not be less than 38 mm casing or finishing nails spaced not more than 150 mm o.c. along edge supports and 300 mm o.c. along intermediate supports, except that staples providing equivalent lateral resistance may also be used.
P/T Sentence Text: Nails for attaching plywood finishes shall not be less than 38 mm casing or finishing nails spaced not more than 150Ã mm o.c. along edge supports and 300 mm o.c. along intermediate supports, except that staples providing equivalent lateral resistance may also be used.
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: Hardboard shall be not less than 3 mm thick where applied over continuous backing, 6 mm thick when applied over supports spaced not more than 400 mm o.c., and 9 mm thick when applied over supports spaced not more than 600 mm o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: Hardboard shall be not less than,(a) 3 mm thick where applied over continuous back-up, (b) 6 mm thick where applied to supports spaced not more than 406 mm o.c., and (c) 9 mm thick where applied to supports spaced not more than 610 mm o.c.
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: All hardboard edges shall be supported by furring, blocking or framing where the backing is not continuous.
P/T Sentence Text: All hardboard edges shall be supported by furring, blocking or framing where the back-up is not continuous.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Insulating fibreboard tile shall be not less than 12.7 mm thick on supports spaced not more than 400 mm o.c.
P/T Sentence Text: Insulating fibreboard tile shall be not less than 12.7 mm thick on supports spaced not more than 406 mm o.c.
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: OSB conforming to CSA O325, Construction Sheathing, shall meet the minimum panel mark of W16, on supports not more than 400 mm o.c., W24, on supports not more than 600 mm o.c., and W16, on supports not more than 600 mm o.c. where blocking is provided at mid-wall height.
P/T Sentence Text: OSB conforming to CSA O325, "Construction Sheathing", shall meet the minimum panel mark of,(a) W16, on supports not more than 406 mm o.c., (b) W24, on supports not more than 610 mm o.c., and (c) W16, on supports not more than 610 mm o.c. where blocking is provided at midwall height.
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: Staples are permitted to be used to fasten wood strip flooring not more than 7.9 mm in thickness provided the staples are not less than 29 mm long with a shank diameter of 1.19 mm and with 4.7 mm crowns.
P/T Sentence Text: Staples are permitted to be used to fasten wood strip flooring not more than 7.9 mm in thickness and not more than 50Ã mm in width provided the staples,(a) are not less than 29 mm long, (b) have a shank diameter of not less than 1.19 mm, (c) have a crown of not less than 4.7 mm, and (d) are spaced not more than 400 mm o.c.
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: In occupancies other than dwelling units, plumbing facilities, grab bars, floor drains, and floor and wall finishes around urinals shall conform to part 3. (See also part 3. regarding barrier-free plumbing facilities.)
P/T Sentence Text: Plumbing facilities, grab bars, floor drains and floor and wall finishes around urinals shall conform to SubsectionÃ 3.7.4. and Article 7.1.5.2. in,(a) a recreational camp, (b) a camp for housing of workers, or (c) all other buildings not described in Sentence (1).
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: Where a piped water supply is available a hot water supply shall be provided in every dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: In a dwelling unit with a water distribution system, a hot water supply shall be provided.
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: Where the building is in a location where the spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.55, service water heaters shall be secured to the structure to prevent overturning. (See Note A-9.31.6.2.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where the building is in a location where the spectral response acceleration, Sa(0.2), is greater than 0.55, service water heaters shall be secured to the structure to resist overturning and displacement. (See Appendix A.)
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: The non-heating-season ventilation required by Clause 9.32.1.2.(1)(a) shall be supplied by natural ventilation in accordance with Article 9.32.2.2., or a mechanical ventilation system in accordance with Article 9.32.2.3.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentence (2), rooms or spaces in a residential occupancy shall be ventilated by natural means in accordance with Subsection 9.32.2.
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: The non-heating-season ventilation required by Clause 9.32.1.2.(1)(a) shall be supplied by natural ventilation in accordance with Article 9.32.2.2., or a mechanical ventilation system in accordance with Article 9.32.2.3.
P/T Sentence Text: The natural ventilation of rooms or spaces required in Sentence (1) may be provided by mechanical means.
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: Openings for natural ventilation other than windows shall provide protection from the weather and insects.
P/T Sentence Text: Openings for natural ventilation other than windows shall be constructed to provide protection from the weather and insects.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: The principal ventilation fan shall be controlled by a manual switch located within the living area of the dwelling unit and clearly marked "VENTILATION FAN." (See Note A-9.32.3.3.(5).)
P/T Sentence Text: The switches required in Sentences (2) and (3) shall be centrally located in the dwelling unit and shall be identified with the words VENTILATION FAN.
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: The requirement for a principal ventilation fan may be satisfied by a single fan, by the exhaust side of a heat recovery ventilator, or by a group of fans, provided all fans in the group are controlled simultaneously by a controller complying with Sentences (5), (6) and (7). (See Note A-9.32.3.3.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: The principal exhaust required in this Article may be provided by means of a heat recovery ventilator installed in accordance with Article 9.32.3.11.
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: A supplemental exhaust fan is not required in a kitchen where the only exhaust air intake for the principal ventilation fan is located in that kitchen.
P/T Sentence Text: An exhaust air intake shall be installed in each kitchen, bathroom and water closet room.
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: The provision of makeup air as described in Sentence 9.32.3.8.(2) is not required for mechanical exhausting devices operating a subfloor depressurization system installed for the purpose of reducing the risk of radon ingress.
P/T Sentence Text: The provision of make-up air is not required for mechanical exhausting devices operating a subfloor depressurization system installed for the purpose of reducing the risk of radon ingress.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Fans, including makeup air supply fans, installed to satisfy Articles 9.32.3.3. to 9.32.3.8. with less than 1 m of duct between themselves and the visible interior surfaces of rooms other than unfinished basements, furnace rooms, utility rooms and attics, shall have a sound rating complying with Table 9.32.3.10.-B when operating at the required flow rate.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for heat recovery ventilators, exhaust fans required to make up any part of the total ventilation capacity required by Article 9.32.3.3. shall have a sound rating not greater than that specified in Table 9.32.3.9.
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: Where an exhaust duct passes through an unheated space or is not separated from an unheated space by an insulated building assembly, the duct shall be insulated to not less than RSI 0.5.
P/T Sentence Text: Where an exhaust duct passes through or is adjacent to unheated space, the duct shall be insulated to not less than RSIÃ 0.5.
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: Intake openings shall be located so as to avoid contamination of the ventilation air from other local sources such as automobile exhaust and exhaust from the building or adjacent buildings.
P/T Sentence Text: Intake openings shall be located so as to avoid contamination of the ventilation air from other local sources such as automobile exhausts and exhaust from adjacent buildings.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: The distance from the bottom of an air intake opening to finished ground or to any nearer and lower permanent horizontal surface shall be not less than 450 mm or the depth of expected snow accumulation, whichever is greater.
P/T Sentence Text: The distance from the bottom of an air intake opening to finished ground level or to any nearer and lower permanent horizontal surface shall be not less than 450 mm or the depth of expected snow accumulation, whichever is greater.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Except as required in Sentence 9.34.1.5.(2), optical fibre cables and electrical wires and cables installed in buildings permitted to be of combustible construction shall not convey flame or continue to burn for more than 1 min when tested in conformance with the Vertical Flame Test (FT1 in CSA C22.2 No. 0.3-09 Test Methods for Electrical Wires and Cables or be located in totally enclosed noncombustible raceways (see Note A-3.1.4.3.(1)(b)(i)), masonry walls, concrete slabs, or totally enclosed non-metallic raceways conforming to Sentence 3.1.5.23.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Except for dwelling units and except as required in Sentence (2), optical fibre cables and electrical wires and cables installed in buildings permitted to be of combustible construction shall,(a) not convey flame or continue to burn for more than 1 min when tested in conformance with the Vertical Flame Test in Clause 4.11.1. of CSA C22.2 No. 0.3, "Test Methods for Electrical Wires and Cables", (FT1 Rating), or (b) be located in, (i) totally enclosed noncombustible raceways, (ii) masonry walls, (iii) concrete slabs, or (iv) totally enclosed non metallic raceways conforming to Clause 3.1.5.20.(1)(b).
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: The stairway lighting for basements that do not contain finished space or lead to an outside entrance or built-in garage and which serve not more than one dwelling unit is permitted to be controlled by a single switch located at the head of the stairs.
P/T Sentence Text: The stairway lighting for basements that do not contain finished space or lead to an outside entrance or built-in garage and that serve not more than one dwelling unit is permitted to be controlled by a single switch located at the head of the stairs.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: A lighting outlet with fixture shall be provided for each 30 m2 or fraction thereof of floor area in unfinished basements.
P/T Sentence Text: A lighting outlet with fixture shall be provided for each 30 mÃÂ² of floor area or fraction of it in unfinished basements.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: The outlet required in Sentence 9.34.2.4.(1) nearest the stairs shall be controlled by a wall switch located at the head of the stairs.
P/T Sentence Text: The outlet required in Sentence (1) nearest the stairs shall be controlled by a wall switch located at the head of the stairs.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: When provided by incandescent lighting, illumination required in Sentence 9.34.2.7.(1) shall conform to Table 9.34.2.7. (See Article 9.9.12.2. for lighting in means of egress.)
P/T Sentence Text: When provided by incandescent lighting, illumination required in Sentence (1) shall conform to Table 9.34.2.7.
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: Where an attached or built-in garage is provided and where adjacent spaces in the building are less than 50mm above the garage floor, the garage floor shall be sloped to the outdoors, or where the garage can accommodate not more than 3 vehicles, an airtight curb or partition not less than 50 mm high shall be installed at the edges of the garage floor adjacent to interior space. (See Note A-9.35.2.2.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Where an attached or built-in garage is provided, the garage floor shall be sloped to drain liquids to the outdoors.

National Article Title: Protection from Damage due to Soil Movement
National Sentence Text: Where slab-on-ground construction is used, a construction joint shall be provided between the main building slab and a slab serving an attached garage, breezeway or carport.

P/T Sentence Text: Where slab-on-ground construction is used, a construction joint shall be provided between the main building slab and the garage or breezeway or carport slab.

National Article Title: Protection from Damage due to Soil Movement
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in part 9., foundations for attached unheated garages or carports shall be below frost level.

P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Section 9.12., foundations for attached unheated garages or carports shall be below frost level.

National Sentence Text: Detached garages of less than 55 m2 floor area and not more than 1 storey in height that are not of masonry or masonry veneer construction need not conform with the foundation drainage requirements stated in part 9., where the finished ground level is at or near the elevation of the garageâs floor and where the ground slopes away from the building.
P/T Sentence Text: Detached garages of less than 55 mÃÂ² floor area and not more than 1 storey in height that are not of masonry or masonry veneer construction need not conform with the foundation drainage requirements described in Section 9.14. where the finished ground level is at or near the elevation of the garage floor and where the ground slopes away from the building.

National Sentence Text: Plumbing fixtures shall not be installed in a room that is not lighted and ventilated in accordance with the appropriate requirements in Parts 3, 6 and 9 of Division B of the NBC.
P/T Sentence Text: Plumbing fixtures shall not be installed in a room that is not lighted and ventilated in accordance with the appropriate requirements in Parts 3 and 9.

National Sentence Text: Where the term pipe or piping is used, it shall also apply to tube or tubing unless otherwise stated.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the term pipe or piping and fittings is used, it shall also apply to tube or tubing and fittings unless otherwise stated.

National Sentence Text: Every fixture shall have a smooth, hard, corrosion-resistant surface free of flaws and blemishes that may interfere with cleaning.
