National Sentence Text: Not more than 6 shower heads shall be served by a single shower drain.
P/T Sentence Text: Not more than six shower heads shall be served by a single shower drain.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: When a water closet is installed in a washroom for public use, it shall be of the elongated type and provided with a seat of the open front type.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for Eastern-Style toilets, where a water closet is installed in a washroom for public use it shall be of the elongated type and provided with a seat of the open front type.
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: Except for a floor-mounted service sink, every trap that serves a lavatory, a sink or a laundry tray shall be provided with a cleanout plug located at the lowest point of the trap and of the same material as the trap, except that a cast-iron trap shall be provided with a brass cleanout plug, or be designed so that part of the trap can be removed for cleaning purposes.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for a floor-mounted service sink, every trap that serves a lavatory, a sink or a laundry tray shall, (a) be provided with a cleanout plug of a minimum ¾ in. size located at the lowest point of the trap and of the same material as the trap, except that a cast iron trap shall be provided with a brass cleanout plug, (b) be designed so that the trap dip can be completely removed for cleaning purposes, or (c) be provided with a cleanout installed above the floor as close as practical downstream of the trap when the trap is, (i) installed below the floor, and (ii) not readily accessible for cleaning as required by Clause (a).
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: Interceptors shall be designed so that they can be readily cleaned.
P/T Sentence Text: Every interceptor shall be designed so that it can be readily cleaned.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Tubular metal or plastic traps conforming to ASME/CSA ASME A112.18.2/CSA B125.2 Plumbing Waste Fittings shall be used only in accessible locations.
P/T Sentence Text: Tubular metal or plastic traps that conform to ASME A112.18.2 / CSA B125.2, "Plumbing Waste Fittings" shall be used in accessible locations.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Precast reinforced circular concrete manhole sections, catch basins and fittings shall conform to CSA A257.4, Precast Reinforced Circular Concrete Manhole Sections, Catch Basins, and Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Precast reinforced circular concrete manhole sections, catch basins and fittings shall conform to CSA A257.4, "Precast Reinforced Circular Concrete Manhole Sections, Catch Basins, and Fittings".
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Polyethylene pipe used underground outside a building for the rehabilitation of existing drainage systems using trenchless technology shall conform to ASTM F 714, Polyethylene (PE) Plastic Pipe (DR-PR) Based on Outside Diameter and shall be HDPE 3408 and SDR 11 or heavier. (See Note A-2.2.5.4.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Polyethylene pipe used underground in a drainage system for rehabilitation of existing systems using trenchless technology shall conform to ASTM F714, "Polyethylene (PE) Plastic Pipe (DR-PR) Based on Outside Diameter" and shall be HDPE 3408, SDR 17 or heavier. (See Appendix A.)
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: Solvent cement for transition joints shall conform to CSA CAN/CSA-B181.1 Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene (ABS) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings or CSA CAN/CSA-B181.2 Polyvinylchloride (PVC) and Chlorinated Polyvinylchloride (CPVC) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Solvent cement for transition joints shall conform to,(a) CAN/CSA-B181.1, "Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene (ABS) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings", or (b) CAN/CSA-B181.2, "Polyvinylchloride (PVC) and Chlorinated Polyvinylchloride (CPVC) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings".
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Transition solvent cement shall only be used for joining an ABS drainage system to a PVC drainage system.
P/T Sentence Text: Transition solvent cement shall only be used for joining an ABS plumbing system to a PVC plumbing system.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 2.2.5.11.(3) and 2.2.5.11.(4), PE/AL/PE pipe and fittings shall not be used in hot water systems.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (3) and (4), PE/AL/PE pipe and fittings shall not be used in a hot water system.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Polypropylene pipe and fittings used for hot and cold potable water systems shall conform to CSA B137.11, Polypropylene (PP-R) Pipe and Fittings for Pressure Applications (See Note A-2.2.5.13.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Polypropylene pipe and fittings used for hot and cold potable water systems shall conform to CSA B137.11, "Polypropylene (PP-R) Pipe and Fittings for Pressure Applications".
Label: Common Sentence

National Article Title: Cast-Iron Drainage and Vent Pipe and Fittings
National Sentence Text: Cast-iron soil pipe and fittings shall not be used in a water system.
P/T Article Title: 7.2.6.1. Cast Iron Frames, Covers, Drainage and Vent Pipe and Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Cast iron soil pipe and fittings shall not be used in a water system.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Threaded cast-iron drainage fittings shall not be used in a water system.
P/T Sentence Text: Threaded cast iron drainage fittings shall not be used in a water system.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Cast-iron water pipes shall conform to AWWA ANSI/AWWA C151/A21.51, Ductile-Iron Pipe, Centrifugally Cast
P/T Sentence Text: Cast iron water pipes shall conform to ANSI/AWWA C151/A21.51, "Ductile-Iron Pipe, Centrifugally Cast".
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Screwed cast-iron water fittings used in a water system shall be cement-mortar lined or galvanized.
P/T Sentence Text: Screwed cast iron water fittings used in a water system shall be cement-mortar lined or galvanized.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Galvanized steel pipe and fittings shall not be used in a water distribution system except in buildings of industrial occupancy as described in the NBC, or for the repair of existing galvanized steel piping systems.
P/T Sentence Text: Galvanized steel pipe and fittings shall not be used in a water distribution system except, (a) in buildings of industrial occupancy, or (b) for the repair of existing galvanized steel piping systems.
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: Galvanized steel pipe and fittings shall conform to ASTM A 53/A 53M, Pipe, Steel, Black and Hot-Dipped, Zinc-Coated, Welded and Seamless
P/T Sentence Text: Galvanized steel pipe and fittings shall conform to ASTM A53 / A53M, "Pipe, Steel, Black and Hot Dipped, Zinc-Coated Welded and Seamless".
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: A sheet metal leader shall not be used except above ground outside a building.
P/T Sentence Text: A sheet metal leader shall not be used except above ground outside a building.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Only grade 304/304L or 316/316L stainless steel pipe shall be used.
P/T Sentence Text: Only grade 304/304L or 316/316L stainless steel pipe shall be used.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Stainless steel pipe flanges shall conform to ASME B16.5-2017 Pipe Flanges and Flanged Fittings: NPS ½ Through NPS 24 Metric/Inch Standard and ASTM A 182/A 182M, Forged or Rolled Alloy and Stainless Steel Pipe Flanges, Forged Fittings, and Valves and Parts for High-Temperature Service or AWWA ANSI/AWWA C228, Stainless-Steel Pipe Flanges for Water Service Sizes 2 in. through 72 in. (50 mm through 1,800 mm)
P/T Sentence Text: Stainless steel pipe flanges shall,(a) conform to ASME B16.5, "Pipe Flanges and Flanged Fittings: NPS ½ through NPS 24 Metric/Inch Standard", and (b) conform to ASTM A182 / A182M, "Forged or Rolled Alloy and Stainless Steel Pipe Flanges, Forged Fittings, and Valves and Parts for High-Temperature Service", or AWWA C228, "Stainless-Steel Pipe Flanges For Water Service Sizes 2 in. through 72 in. (50 mm through 1 800 mm)".
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Only grade 304/304L or 316/316L stainless steel tube shall be used.
P/T Sentence Text: Only grade 304/304L or 316/316L stainless steel tubes shall be used.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 2.2.7.4.(3), the use of copper tube shall conform to Table 2.2.7.4.
P/T Sentence Text: The use of copper tube shall conform to Table 7.2.7.4.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Brazing alloys shall conform to AWS ANSI/AWS A5.8M/A5.8, Filler Metals for Brazing and Braze Welding BCuP range.
P/T Sentence Text: Brazing alloys shall conform to ANSI/AWS A5.8M / A5.8, "Filler Metals for Brazing and Brazed Welding", BCuP range.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Mechanical couplings for non-pressure applications shall conform to CSA B602 Mechanical Couplings for Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Sewer Pipe
P/T Sentence Text: Mechanical Couplings for DWV and Sewer Pipe shall be certified to CSA B602, "Mechanical Couplings for Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Sewer Pipe".
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Direct flush valves shall open fully and close positively under service pressure, complete their cycle of operation automatically, be provided with a means of regulating the volume of water that they discharge, and be provided with a vacuum breaker unless the fixture is designed so that back-siphonage cannot occur.
P/T Sentence Text: Every direct flush valve shall,(a) open fully and close positively under service pressure, (b) complete its cycle of operation automatically, (c) be provided with a means of regulating the volume of water that it discharges, and (d) be provided with a vacuum breaker unless the fixture is designed so that back-siphonage cannot occur.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Water hammer arresters shall conform to ASSE ANSI/ASSE 1010, Water Hammer Arresters
P/T Sentence Text: Factory built water hammer arresters shall conform to ANSI/ASSE 1010, "Water Hammer Arresters".
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Wiped joints in straight pipe shall be made of solder, have an exposed surface on each side of the joint at least 19 mm wide, and be not less than 10 mm thick at the thickest part.
P/T Sentence Text: Every wiped joint in straight pipe shall,(a) be made of solder, (b) have an exposed surface on each side of the joint at least 19 mm wide, and (c) be at least 10 mm thick at the thickest part.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Wiped flanged joints shall be reinforced with a lead flange that is not less than 19 mm wide.
P/T Sentence Text: Every wiped flanged joint shall be reinforced with a lead flange that is at least 19 mm wide.
Label: Common Sentence

National Article Title: Prohibition of Welding of Pipes and Fittings
National Sentence Text: Cast-iron soil pipe and fittings shall not be welded.
P/T Article Title: 7.3.3.3. Prohibition of Welding of Pipes and Fittings
P/T Sentence Text: Cast iron soil pipe and fittings shall not be welded.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Connections between 2 pipes of different sizes shall be made with an increaser or a reducer fitting installed so that it permits the system to be completely drained.
P/T Sentence Text: Every connection between two pipes of different size shall be made with an increaser or a reducer fitting installed so that it will permit the system to be completely drained.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Adaptors, connectors or mechanical joints used to join dissimilar materials shall be designed to accommodate the required transition.
P/T Sentence Text: Adapters, connectors or mechanical joints used to join dissimilar materials shall be designed to accommodate the required transition.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Pedestal urinals, floor-mounted water closets and S-trap standards shall be connected to a fixture drain by a floor flange or other means of connection, except that a cast-iron trap standard may be caulked to a cast-iron pipe.
P/T Sentence Text: Every pedestal urinal, floor-mounted water closet or S-trap standard shall be connected to a fixture drain by a floor flange or other means of connection, except that a cast iron trap standard may be caulked to a cast iron pipe.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: The design and installation of every piping system shall include means to accommodate its expansion and contraction caused by temperature changes, movement of the soil, building shrinkage or structural settlement. (See Note A-2.3.3.9.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: The design and installation of every piping system shall, where necessary, include means to accommodate expansion and contraction of the piping system caused by temperature change or building shrinkage. (See Appendix A.)
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 2.3.3.12.(2), joints in copper tubes installed underground shall be made with either flared or compression fittings, or be brazed using a brazing alloy within the American Welding Society's AWS-BCuP range.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), joints in copper tubes installed underground shall be,(a) made with either flared or compression fittings, or (b) brazed using a brazing alloy within the American Welding Society s AWS-BCuP range.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Floor-mounted and wall-mounted water-closet bowls shall be securely attached to the floor or wall by means of a flange and shall be stable.
P/T Sentence Text: Every floor or wall mounted water closet bowl shall be securely attached to the floor or wall by means of a flange and shall be stable.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Where a hanger or support for copper tube or brass or copper pipe is of a material other than brass or copper, it shall be suitably separated and electrically insulated from the pipe or tube.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a hanger or support for copper tube or brass or copper pipe is of a material other than brass or copper, it shall be suitably separated and electrically insulated from the pipe or tube to prevent galvanic action.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Where PEX, PP-R, PE/AL/PE or PEX/AL/PEX plastic pipe is installed, hangers shall not compress, cut or abrade the pipe.
P/T Sentence Text: Reserved
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 2.3.4.6.(2), nominally horizontal piping that is underground shall be supported on a base that is firm and continuous under the whole of the pipe. (See Note A-2.3.4.6.(1).)
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), nominally horizontal piping that is underground shall be supported on a base that is firm and continuous under the whole of the pipe.
Label: Common Sentence

National Article Title: Support for Vent Pipe above a Roof
National Sentence Text: Where a vent pipe that may be subject to misalignment terminates above the surface of a roof, it shall be supported or braced. (See Article 2.5.6.5. for location of vent pipe terminals.)
P/T Article Title: 7.3.4.7. Support for Vent Pipe Above a Roof
P/T Sentence Text: Where a vent pipe terminates above the surface of a roof, it shall be supported or braced to prevent misalignment.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Where piping may be exposed to freezing conditions, it shall be protected from the effects of freezing.
P/T Sentence Text: Where piping may be exposed to freezing conditions, it shall be protected from the effects of freezing.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Piping used as an internal leader, which may be subject to condensation, shall be installed in a manner that limits the risk of damage to the building due to condensation.
P/T Sentence Text: Piping used for internal leaders, which may be subject to condensation, shall be installed in a manner that limits the risk of damage to the building due to condensation.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Air pressure tests shall be conducted in accordance with the manufacturer's instructions for each piping material, and air shall be forced into the system until a pressure of 35 kPa is created, and this pressure shall be maintained for at least 15 min without a drop in pressure.
P/T Sentence Text: Where an air test is made, it shall be conducted in accordance with the manufacturer s instructions for the piping materials, and,(a) air shall be forced into the system until a gauge pressure of 35 kPa is created, and (b) this pressure shall be maintained for at least 15 min without a drop in pressure.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Where a change in direction of more than 45° occurs in a soil-or-waste pipe that serves more than one clothes washer, and in which pressure zones are created by detergent suds, no other soil-or-waste pipe shall be connected to it within a length less than 40 times the size of the soil-or-waste pipe or 2.44 m maximum vertical, whichever is less, before changing direction, and 10 times the size of the nominally horizontal soil-or-waste pipe after changing direction.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a change in direction of more than 45° occurs in a soil or waste pipe that serves more than one clothes washer, and in which pressure zones are created by detergent suds, no other soil or waste pipe shall be connected to it within a length less than, (a) 40 times the size of the soil or waste pipe or 2.44 m maximum vertical, whichever is less, before the change in direction, and (b) 10 times the size of the nominally horizontal soil or waste pipe after the change in direction. (See Appendix A.)
Label: Common Sentence

National Article Title: Connection of Overflows from Rainwater Tanks
National Sentence Text: An overflow from a rainwater tank shall not be directly connected to a drainage system.
P/T Article Title: 7.4.2.2. Connection of Overflows from Rainwater Tanks
P/T Sentence Text: Where an overflow from a rainwater tank is connected to a storm drainage system, it shall be connected by,(a) an air break, or (b) a backwater valve installed on the storm drainage pipe before the connection to the storm building drain.
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: Where a fixture or equipment discharges sewage or waste that may damage or impair the sanitary drainage system or the functioning of a public or private sewage disposal system, provision shall be made for treatment of the sewage or waste before it is discharged to the sanitary drainage system.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a fixture or equipment discharges sewage or waste that may damage or impair the sanitary drainage system or the functioning of a sanitary sewage works or sanitary sewage system, provision shall be made for treatment of the sewage or waste before it is discharged to the sanitary drainage system.
Label: Variation

National Article Title: Cooling of Hot Water or Sewage
National Sentence Text: Where a fixture discharges sewage or clear-water waste that is at a temperature above 75°C, provision shall be made for cooling of the waste to 75°C or less before it is discharged to the drainage system.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a fixture discharges sewage or clear water waste that has been heated, the drainage system shall be suitable for the temperature of the sewage or clear water waste being discharged.
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences 2.4.5.1.(2) to 2.4.5.1.(5) and in Article 2.4.5.2., fixtures shall be protected by a separate trap.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences (2) and (3) and Article 7.4.5.2., every fixture shall be protected by a separate trap.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: An indirectly connected fixture that can discharge only clear-water waste other than a drinking fountain need not be protected by a trap. (See Sentence 2.4.2.1.(1) for indirect connections.)
P/T Sentence Text: Reserved
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: Provision shall be made for maintaining the trap seal of a floor drain by the use of a trap seal primer, using the drain as a receptacle for an indirectly connected drinking fountain, or other equally effective means.
P/T Sentence Text: Provision shall be made for maintaining the trap seal of a floor drain or a hub drain by the use of a trap seal primer, by using the drain as a receptacle for an indirectly connected drinking fountain, or by equally effective means.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: A backwater valve is permitted to be installed in a building drain provided that it is a "normally open" design conforming to CSA B70 Cast Iron Soil Pipe, Fittings, and Means of Joining CSA CAN/CSA-B181.1 Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene (ABS) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings CSA CAN/CSA-B181.2 Polyvinylchloride (PVC) and Chlorinated Polyvinylchloride (CPVC) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings or CSA CAN/CSA-B182.1 Plastic Drain and Sewer Pipe and Pipe Fittings and it does not serve more than one dwelling unit.
P/T Sentence Text: A backwater valve may be installed in a building drain provided that,(a) it is a "normally open" design conforming to, (i) CAN/CSA-B70, "Cast Iron Soil Pipe, Fittings, and Means of Joining", (ii) CAN/CSA-B181.1, "Acrylonitrile-Butadiene-Styrene (ABS) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings", (iii) CAN/CSA-B181.2, "Polyvinylchloride (PVC) and Chlorinated Polyvinylchloride (CPVC) Drain, Waste, and Vent Pipe and Pipe Fittings", or (iv) CAN/CSA-B182.1, "Plastic Drain and Sewer Pipe and Pipe Fittings", and (b) it does not serve more than one dwelling unit.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: A subsoil drainage pipe that drains into a sanitary drainage system that is subject to surcharge shall be connected in such a manner that sewage cannot back up into the subsoil drainage pipe. (See Note A-2.4.6.4.(6).)
P/T Sentence Text: A subsoil drainage pipe that drains into a sanitary drainage system that is subject to surcharge shall be connected in such a manner that sewage cannot back up into the subsoil drainage pipe.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: A building sewer intended to serve a mobile home shall be not less than 4 inches in size, terminated above ground, provided with a tamperproof terminal connection that is capable of being repeatedly connected, disconnected and sealed, a protective concrete pad, and a means to protect it from frost heave, and designed and constructed in accordance with good engineering practice.
P/T Sentence Text: A building sewer intended to serve a mobile home shall,(a) be not less than 4 in. in size, (b) be terminated above ground, (c) be provided with, (i) a tamperproof terminal connection that is capable of being repeatedly connected, disconnected and sealed, (ii) a protective concrete pad, and (iii) a means to protect it from frost heave, and (d) be designed and constructed in accordance with good engineering practice.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Sanitary drainage systems and storm drainage systems shall be provided with cleanouts that will permit cleaning of the entire system.
P/T Sentence Text: Every sanitary drainage system and storm drainage system shall be provided with cleanouts that will permit cleaning of the entire system.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: The developed length of a building sewer between the building and the first manhole to which the building sewer connects shall not exceed 75 m.
P/T Sentence Text: The developed length of a building sewer between the building and the first manhole to which the building sewer connects shall not exceed 30 m.
Label: Variation

National Article Title: Hydraulic Loads from Roofs or Paved Surfaces
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 2.4.10.4.(2), the hydraulic load in litres from a roof or paved surface is the maximum 15 min rainfall determined in conformance with Subsection 1.1.3. of Division B of the NBC, multiplied by the sum of the area in square metres of the horizontal projection of the surface drained, and one-half the area in square metres of the largest adjoining vertical surface.
P/T Article Title: 7.4.10.4. Hydraulic Loads from Roofs or Paved Surfaces
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), the hydraulic load in litres from a roof or paved surface is the maximum 15 min rainfall determined in conformance with MMAH Supplementary Standard SB-1, "Climatic and Seismic Data", multiplied by the sum of,(a) the area in square metres of the horizontal projection of the surface drained, and (b) one-half the area in square metres of the largest adjoining vertical surface. (See Appendix A.)
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: Where the nominally horizontal offset in a soil-or-waste stack is 1.5 m or more, the hydraulic load that is served by it shall conform to Table 2.4.10.6.-B or Table 2.4.10.6.-C, whichever is the less restrictive.
P/T Article Title: 7.4.10.6. Hydraulic Loads to Soil or Waste Pipes
P/T Sentence Text: Where the nominally horizontal offset in a soil or waste stack is 1 500 mm or more, the hydraulic load that is served by it shall conform to Table 7.4.10.8.
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: The hydraulic load that is drained to a leader shall conform to Table 2.4.10.11.
P/T Sentence Text: The hydraulic load that is drained to a rain leader shall conform to Table 7.4.10.10.
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: A soil-or-waste pipe is permitted to serve as a wet vent, provided the hydraulic load is in accordance with Table 2.5.8.1., the number of wet-vented water closets does not exceed 2, where 2 water closets are installed, they are connected at the same level by means of a double sanitary T fitting if the vent pipe is vertical and by means of a double Y fitting if the vent pipe is horizontal, the water closets are installed downstream of all other fixtures, trap arms and fixture drains connected to the wet vent do not exceed 2 inches in size, except for connections from emergency floor drains in accordance with Sentence 2.5.1.1.(3), the total hydraulic load on the wet vent does not exceed the limits stated in Table 2.5.8.1. when separately vented branches or fixture drains in the same storey, having a total hydraulic load not greater than 2 fixture units, are connected to the wet vent or a wet-vented water closet trap arm, the hydraulic load of separately vented fixtures that drain into the wet vent are not included when sizing the continuous vent that serves the wet vent, where a wet vent extends through more than one storey, the total discharge from any one storey above the first storey does not exceed 4 fixture units, there is not more than one nominally horizontal offset in the wet vent, and the offset does not exceed 1.2 m for pipes 2 inches or less in size, or the offset does not exceed 2.5 m for pipes larger than 2 inches in size, the wet-vented portion is not reduced in size except for the portion that is upstream of emergency floor drains in accordance with Sentence 2.5.1.1.(3), and the length of the wet vent is not limited.
P/T Sentence Text: A soil or waste pipe may serve as a wet vent provided that,(a) the hydraulic load is in accordance with Table 7.5.8.1., (b) the number of wet vented water closets does not exceed two, (c) when two water closets are installed, they are connected at the same level to a vertical part of the stack by means of a double fitting in accordance with Table 7.2.4.5., (d) the water closets are installed downstream of all other fixtures, (e) trap arms and fixture drains connected to the wet vent do not exceed 2 in. in size, except for connections from floor drains in accordance with Clauses 7.5.1.1.(3)(a) to (c), (f) the total hydraulic load on the wet vent does not exceed the limits stated in Table 7.5.8.1. when separately vented branches or fixture drains in the same storey, having a total hydraulic load not greater than two fixture units, are connected to a wet vent or a wet vented water closet trap arm, (g) the hydraulic load of separately vented fixtures that drain into the wet vent is not included when sizing the continuous vent that serves the wet vent, (h) where a wet vent extends through more than 1 storey, the total discharge from any 1 storey above the first storey does not exceed four fixture units, (i) where a wet vent extends through more than 1 storey, there is not more than one nominally horizontal offset in the wet vent, and, (i) the offset does not exceed 1 200 mm for pipes 2 in. or less in size, or (ii) the offset does not exceed 2 500 mm for pipes larger than 2 in. in size, (j) the wet vented portion is not reduced in size except for the portion that is upstream of floor drains in accordance with Clauses 7.5.1.1.(3)(a) to (c), (k) the highest fixture is connected to a vertical portion of the wet vent, upstream of any other fixtures, in the form of a continuous vent, and (l) the length of the wet vent is not limited.
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: A section of horizontal branch is permitted to be circuit-vented, provided a circuit vent is connected to it, all fixtures served by the circuit vent are located in the same storey, and no soil-or-waste stack is connected to it upstream of a circuit-vented fixture.
P/T Sentence Text: A section of a horizontal branch may be circuit vented provided,(a) a circuit vent is connected to it, (b) all fixtures served by the circuit vent are located in the same storey and located at the most distant upstream section of the horizontal branch, and (c) no soil or waste stack is connected to it upstream of a circuit vented fixture.
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: Additional circuit vents shall be required where each cumulative horizontal change in direction of a branch served by a circuit vent exceeds 45° between vent pipe connections, or where more than 8 circuit-vented fixtures are connected to a branch between vent pipe connections.
P/T Sentence Text: Additional circuit vents shall be required,(a) when each cumulative horizontal change in direction of a branch served by a circuit vent exceeds 45° between vent pipe connections, or (b) where more than eight circuit vented fixtures are connected to a branch between vent pipe connections.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Additional circuit vents shall be sized in accordance with Table 2.5.7.1. and Sentence 2.5.7.3.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Additional circuit vents shall be sized in accordance with Table 7.5.7.1. and Sentence 7.5.7.3.(1).
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence 2.5.4.2.(2), every soil-or-waste stack draining fixtures from more than 4 storeys that contain plumbing fixtures shall have a vent stack.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentence (2), every soil or waste stack draining fixtures from more than 4 storeys shall have a vent stack.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: The vent stack required by Sentence 2.5.4.2.(1) shall be connected to a vertical section of the soil-or-waste stack at or immediately below the lowest soil-or-waste pipe connected to the soil-or-waste stack.
P/T Sentence Text: The vent stack required by Sentence (1) shall be connected to a vertical section of the soil or waste stack at or immediately below the lowest soil or waste pipe connected to the soil or waste stack.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Adjacent compartments within an oil interceptor shall be connected to each other by a vent opening.
P/T Sentence Text: Adjacent compartments within every oil interceptor shall be connected to each other by a vent opening.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Where provision is made for a fixture to be installed in the future, the drainage system and venting system shall be sized accordingly and provision shall be made for the necessary future connections.
P/T Sentence Text: Where provision is made for a fixture to be installed in the future, the drainage system and venting system shall be sized accordingly and provision made for the necessary future connections.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 2.5.7.1., the minimum size of an offset relief vent is permitted to be one size smaller than the size of the stack vent.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 7.5.7.1., the minimum size of an offset relief vent is permitted to be one size smaller than the size of the stack vent.
Label: Common Sentence

National Article Title: Branch Vents, Vent Headers, Continuous Vents and Circuit Vents
National Sentence Text: Branch vents, vent headers, circuit vents and continuous vents shall be sized in accordance with Table 2.5.8.3., unless they are individual vents or dual vents.
P/T Article Title: 7.5.8.3. Branch Vents, Headers, Continuous Vents and Circuit Vents
P/T Sentence Text: Branch vents, headers, circuit vents and continuous vents shall be sized in accordance with Table 7.5.8.3., unless they are individual vents or dual vents.
Label: Common Sentence

National Article Title: Branch Vents, Vent Headers, Continuous Vents and Circuit Vents
National Sentence Text: For the purposes of Table 2.5.8.3., the length of a continuous vent shall be its developed length from the vertical soil-or-waste pipe connection to a vent stack, stack vent, vent header or outside air.
P/T Article Title: 7.5.8.3. Branch Vents, Headers, Continuous Vents and Circuit Vents
P/T Sentence Text: For the purposes of Table 7.5.8.3., the length of a continuous vent shall be its developed length from the vertical soil or waste pipe connection to a vent stack, stack vent, header or open air.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Installed air admittance valves shall be accessible, and located in a space that allows air to enter the valve.
P/T Sentence Text: Installed air admittance valves shall be,(a) accessible, and (b) located in a space that allows air to enter the valve.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Drainage systems shall have at least one vent that terminates to the outdoors in conformance with Sentence 2.5.6.5.(1).
P/T Sentence Text: Every drainage system shall have one vent that terminates to open air in conformance with Sentence 7.5.6.5.(1).
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Except for risers that serve only one dwelling unit, risers shall be provided with a shut-off valve located at the source of supply.
P/T Sentence Text: Except for a house containing not more than one dwelling unit, every riser shall be provided with a shut-off valve at the source of supply.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: In buildings of residential occupancy that contain more than one dwelling unit, a shut-off valve shall be installed where the water supply enters each dwelling unit, so that, when the water supply to one suite is shut off, the water supply to the remainder of the building is not interrupted. (See Note A-2.6.1.3.(5).)
P/T Sentence Text: Shut-off valves shall be installed in every suite in a building of residential occupancy as may be necessary to ensure that when the supply to one suite is shut off the supply to the remainder of the building is not interrupted. (See Appendix A.)
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: Pipes that pass through an exterior wall to supply water to the exterior of the building shall be provided with a frost-proof hydrant, or a stop-and-waste cock located inside the building and close to the wall.
P/T Sentence Text: Every pipe that passes through an exterior wall to supply water to the exterior of the building shall be provided with,(a) a frost-proof hydrant with a separate shut-off valve located inside the building, or (b) a stop-and-waste cock located inside the building and close to the wall.
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: A check valve shall be installed at the building end of a water service pipe where the pipe is made of plastic that is suitable for cold water use only.
P/T Sentence Text: A check valve shall be installed at the building end of the water service pipe where the pipe is made of plastic that is suitable for cold water use only. (See Appendix A.)
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Systems for solar heating of potable water shall be installed in conformance with CSA CAN/CSA-F383 Installation of Packaged Solar Domestic Hot Water Systems
P/T Sentence Text: Packaged systems for solar heating of potable water in residential occupancies shall be installed in conformance with CAN/CSA-F383, "Installation of Packaged Solar Domestic Hot Water Systems".
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: A water service pipe intended to serve a mobile home shall be not less than ¾ inch in size, terminate above ground, and be provided with a tamperproof terminal connection that is capable of being repeatedly connected, disconnected and sealed, a protective concrete pad, a means to protect it from frost heave, and a curb stop and a means of draining that part of the pipe located above the frost line when not in use.
P/T Sentence Text: A water service pipe intended to serve a mobile home shall,(a) be not less than ¾ in. in size, (b) be terminated above ground, and (c) be provided with, (i) a tamperproof terminal connection that is capable of being repeatedly connected, disconnected and sealed, (ii) a protective concrete pad, (iii) a means to protect it from frost heave, and (iv) a curb stop and a means of draining that part of the pipe located above the frost line when not in use.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Where a hose bibb is installed outside a building, inside a garage or in an area where there is an identifiable risk of contamination, the potable water system shall be protected against backflow through the hose bibb.
P/T Sentence Text: Where a hose bibb is installed outside a building, inside a garage, or where there is an identifiable risk of contamination, the potable water system shall be protected against backflow by a backflow preventer.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Article 2.6.2.4., backflow caused by back pressure of non-toxic substances into a potable water system shall be prevented by the installation of an air gap, a dual check valve backflow preventer with atmospheric port, a dual check valve backflow preventer, a dual check valve backflow preventer with vent, a double check valve assembly, or a reduced pressure principle backflow preventer.
P/T Sentence Text: Backflow preventers shall be provided in conformance with Sentence 7.2.10.10.(1).
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: Backflow preventers required by Sentence (2) shall be installed upstream of the fire department pumper connection. (See Note A-2.6.2.4.(3).)
P/T Sentence Text: The backflow preventer required by Sentence (2) shall be installed upstream of the fire department pumper connection.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Where fixtures are supplied with both hot and cold water, the hydraulic loads for maximum separate demands shall be 75% of the hydraulic load of the fixture units given in Tables 2.6.3.2.-A and 2.6.3.2.-D when using a detailed engineering design method.
P/T Sentence Text: Where fixtures are supplied with both hot and cold water, the hydraulic loads for maximum separate demands shall be 75% of the hydraulic load of the fixture units given in Tables 7.6.3.2.A. and 7.6.3.2.D. when using a detailed engineering design method.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: Where the static pressure at any fixture may exceed 550 kPa, a pressure-reducing valve shall be installed to limit the maximum static pressure at the fixture to 550 kPa.
P/T Sentence Text: Where the static pressure at any fixture may exceed 550 kPa, a pressure reducing valve conforming to Article 7.2.10.12. shall be installed to limit the maximum static pressure at the fixture to 550 kPa.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: For fixtures listed in Table 2.6.3.2.-A that are permitted to have a supply pipe 3/8 inch in size, a connector not more than 750 mm long and not less than 6.3 mm inside diameter may be used to supply water to the fixture.
P/T Sentence Text: For fixtures listed in Table 7.6.3.2.A that have a permitted supply pipe size of 3/8 in., a connector not more than 750 mm long and not less than 6.3 mm inside diameter may be used to supply water to the fixture or device.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: No water system between the point of connection with the water service pipe or the water meter and the first branch that supplies a water heater that serves more than one fixture shall be sized less than ¾ inch.
P/T Sentence Text: No water system between the point of connection with the water service pipe or the water meter and the first branch that supplies a water heater that serves more than one fixture shall be less than ¾ in. in size.
Label: Common Sentence

National Sentence Text: A non-potable water system shall not be connected to a potable water system.
P/T Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Sentences (2) and (3), a non-potable water system shall not be connected to a potable water system.
Label: Variation

National Sentence Text: Non-potable water piping shall not be located where food is prepared in a food-processing plant, above food-handling equipment, above a non-pressurized potable water tank, or above a cover of a pressurized potable water tank.
P/T Sentence Text: Non-potable water piping shall not be located,(a) where food is prepared in a food processing plant, (b) above food-handling equipment, (c) above a non-pressurized potable water tank, or (d) above a cover of a pressurized potable water tank.
Label: Common Sentence
